The kithangian—a horrifying amalgam of [horse](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=62) and [scorpion](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=87) also known as a “beast demon”—is a foul fiend born of the souls of mortals who abused and tormented animals in life. Kithangians tend to roam wild areas rife with animals to torture, though humanoid settlements with plenty of pets or livestock also make for tantalizing hunting grounds. Uncontested for too long, a kithangian's presence has a corrupting influence on the local fauna, which birth fiendish monstrosities until the demon is vanquished. If it realizes it's being tracked by vengeful [druids](/Classes.aspx?ID=6) or demon slayers, a kithangian assumes the shape of an unassuming animal so it can get the jump on its pursuers. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Kithangian](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2457) **Source** [Pathfinder #188: They Watched the Stars](/Sources.aspx?ID=194) pg. 85 **Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=293), [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +20, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +20, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +21, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +16 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +5 **Int** -2 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +3 --- **AC** 28 **Fort** +20 **Ref** +15 **Will** +19 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 205 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10, good 10 **[All-Around Vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=1)**
**Animal Kindness Vulnerability** Kithangians find kindness to animals revolting. The first time each round that a kithangian sees someone heal or otherwise provide aid to a creature that has the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) trait, the kithangian takes 3d6 mental damage. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** pincer +21 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d12+9 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** stinger +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+9 piercing plus kithangian venom **Divine Innate Spells** DC 25 - **1st** [Command](/Spells.aspx?ID=45) (at will; animals only) - **3rd** [Paralyze](/Spells.aspx?ID=213) (×2) - **4th** [Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) - **Constant (4th)** [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) **Divine Rituals** DC 25 - **1st** [Abyssal Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=21) **Animal Killer** A kithangian's melee Strikes deal an additional 2d6 damage to animals. **Change Shape** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The kithangian can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9). This doesn't change its Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal. **Kithangian Venom** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 25 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 2d6 poison damage (2 rounds); **Stage 2** 2d6 poison damage and [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (2 rounds); **Stage 3** 3d6 poison damage and sickened 2 (2 rounds) **Rasping Tongues** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** The kithangian has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) in one or both pincers; **Effect** Barbed tongues slither out of the faces in the kithangian's pincers. The tongues burrow into grabbed creatures and inject their minds with haunting psychic screams. Each grabbed creature takes 2d8 piercing damage and 2d8 mental damage. A creature can try to resist the mental damage by attempting a DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save.
Demon Hunters Reclaimers of the Sarkoris Scar who follow the [Green Faith](/Deities.aspx?ID=22) consider kithangians particularly heinous foes. They take grim satisfaction in hunting and slaying such demons, viewing their extermination as just vengeance for the evils these demons visit upon wildlife.
name: Kithangian
